conversation.thought:

The only parent ranked higher than me at N_D is P_D, for whom N_D is their last choice (5th), meaning P_D is unlikely to apply here in Round 1. My main competition is Parent_C (3rd priority), who prefers N_D first.

By applying to Nursery_D immediately, I leverage my 2nd priority status over Parent_C's 3rd priority status, guaranteeing a match at my 4th preferred nursery, which is a strategically superior outcome than risking rejection at N_C and potentially falling to N_E.
